analytic.title: Les controverses christologiques en syriaque: controverses réelles et controverses imaginées

biblStruct.note: It is only in Syriac that one can read Christological texts from all three of the main ecclesial traditions that emerged as a result of the controversies over the Council of Chalcedon. After noting some of the ambiguities surrounding certain of the standard technical terms, and the confusion this caused, a brief outline is given of the various forms in which Christological controversies are encountered in Syriac. By way of illustration, two different texts, one of a real dialogue, the other imagined, are presented in more detail: first, the record of conversations between Chalcedonian and Miaphysite bishops in Constantinople in 532, and second, a verse dialogue between Cyril and Nestorius, transmitted in the East Syriac tradition.
